meanings.sent1: The smell of rotten eggs yocked me.
meanings.sent2: I yocked at the sight of the slimy bug.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating a worm yocked the kids during the science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The gruesome scene in the horror movie yocked the audience.
meanings.sent5: The putrid garbage left out in the sun yocked everyone in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To be extremely tired or exhausted.
meanings.sent1: After running a marathon, I was completely yocked.
meanings.sent2: Working two jobs back-to-back yocked me out.
meanings.sent3: The long hike up the mountain yocked the group of friends.
meanings.sent4: Studying for hours straight yocked my brain.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout session yocked my muscles for days.
